index.title: Justin Urbanek - Me
paragraphs: Welcome to my personal website! I am Justin Urbanek, a passionate computer science apprentice in my fourth year.
Currently, I am completing my apprenticeship at Kauz Informatik Medien AG and attending the BBZW Sursee vocational training center.
index.buttonAriaLabel: Here you can learn more about me
index.catchphraseText: {age}-year-old aspiring developer with a passion for computer science
index.experienceMainText: Throughout my training and professional work, I have participated in a variety of projects, from school projects, work projects, and private projects to hackathon projects. My most notable projects can be viewed here.

about.title: About me
about.subTitle: Crooked keyboard, crooked back, crooked fingers

hobbies.title: Creative writing
hobbies.text: My greatest passion is dedicated to creative writing. I have discovered that writing and coming up with stories is what fulfills me the most personally. At the moment, I only write smaller works or concepts.
hobbies.linkAriaLabel: Find out more about my writing

hobbies.title: Programming and coding
hobbies.text: Programming is a hobby that you can spend your free time on productively, and it can also be part of your profession. I enjoy programming the frontend as well as the backend logic of websites. The languages I use are C#, JS/TS, Python, and unfortunately also PHP ðŸ˜ª.
hobbies.linkAriaLabel: Find out more about my programming

hobbies.title: Gaming
hobbies.text: Gaming is a generally good stress reliever and a hobby for many. My favorite genres are RPGs, hack 'n' slay and horror. The PC is my main platform and The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is my favorite game.
hobbies.imageAltText: A wallpaper about the game 'The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt'
hobbies.linkAriaLabel: Find out more about my gaming preferences

hobbies.title: Reading
hobbies.text: Reading is becoming an increasingly prevalent hobby. I like to read books to expand my vocabulary and to immerse myself in other worlds. My favorite genres are fantasy, sci-fi, and thrillers.
hobbies.linkAriaLabel: Find out more about my reading habits

timelines.title: Compulsory Schooling
timelines.text: Mandatory schooling at primary and secondary school in Lucerne. Completed secondary school in the summer of 2020.

timelines.title: Center for Bridge Programs (ZBA) Lucerne
timelines.text: Attended the Center for Bridge Programs (ZBA) in Lucerne. During this time, I was able to improve my academic performance and prepare for apprenticeship.

timelines.title: Apprenticeship as a computer scientist in application development (Kauz Informatik Medien AG)
timelines.text: Apprenticeship as an application development IT specialist at Kauz Informatik Medien AG in Ballwil. During the apprenticeship, I became familiar with Google Workspace, various front-end and back-end technologies, as well as the design and implementation of web applications. Close customer contact was also part of my duties.

timelines.title: Apprenticeship as a computer scientist in application development (BBZW Sursee)
timelines.text: During the theoretical part of the apprenticeship, I attended the Berufsbildungszentrum fÃ¼r Wirtschaft und Informatik (BBZW) in Sursee. There, in addition to the basics of the curriculum, I gained knowledge of Microsoft Office.

projectMenuItems.title: Kauz Website
projectMenuItems.text: The Kauz Website was a project to redesign the website of Kauz Informatik Medien AG. I helped with the implementation of the design.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: This was an internal project and my tasks included implementing design elements. I had the freedom to design the elements as long as usability, functionality, and basic requirements were ensured.

projectMenuItems.title: Magical Imagery
projectMenuItems.text: Magical Imagery was a pilot project as part of a module in my apprenticeship and was meant to simulate how to plan and implement a real project. It is an online shop for photography and art, aimed at creating a simple platform for artists to sell their works.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: An online shop that should meet both private and business needs. The challenge was to create a simple and intuitive user interface that is easy to use for both artists and customers. The motivation for this idea was to make life easier for artists and allow them to sell their works on our platform without the legal hurdles of their own shop. We also wanted to provide freedom for AI-generated artworks.

slides.imageAltText: Image of the detailed view of a product
Image of the create product view

projectMenuItems.title: Blazor Templates
projectMenuItems.text: The Blazor Templates are a small collection of templates for Blazor web projects. They are intended for developers looking for a quick and easy template for their projects.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: All Blazor templates consist of the same structure, which separates the database logic and the user interface; written as a Blazor web app. Currently, there are 4 templates: a standard Blazor web app, the standard one with Radzen as a UI library, and two more standard ones with Blazorise as a UI library; one with TailwindCSS and the other with Bootstrap.

projectMenuItems.title: Hackathon
projectMenuItems.text: In 2022, three colleageus and myself participated in the Young Talents Hackathon, organized by UMB AG and ICT-Berufsbildung Zentralschweiz. We were supposed to develop a vacation planner for the employees of HSLU.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: The actual implementation was rather poor; it was our first attempt to develop a web app. In the end, we developed and presented a simple web app with VueJs as the frontend and .Net as the REST API. Not much came of it, but it was an interesting experience.

projectMenuItems.title: Scavenger-Hunt-Ionic-App
projectMenuItems.text: As the name suggests, the Scavenger Hunt is a scavenger hunt app. This small app was developed by me and two colleagues as part of a Inter-company vocational training course.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: The app is written in Ionic and Angular. In the app, you can do scavenger hunts with a total of 6 tasks, where potatoes are distributed if you spend too much time on a task. All scavenger hunts can be viewed in a leaderboard. The data is stored in the local storage of the device, and during the course, the players' performance was stored in a Google spreadsheet. The source code is currently not publicly available.

slides.imageAltText: Home page of the scavenger hunt app with ranking list
Screenshot of the first task where sensors are used
Image of the task where users have to walk
Game scene in which the device is shaken or rotated
Final image with evaluation of the scavenger hunt

projectMenuItems.title: Powershell Word-Header replacer
projectMenuItems.text: The Powershell Word-Header replacer is a small script that a colleague and I developed in our first year of our apprenticeship within 3 days. The goal of the script was to replace the headers and footers of Word documents with those of another.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: A teacher asked us if we could develop such a script because they needed it for work, and PowerShell was specified as the language. The script uses the built-in Word API from Microsoft and can replace the headers and footers of Word documents, but unfortunately, it doesn't always work. I have made many attempts to improve the script over the years, but none have been crowned with success.A teacher asked us if we could develop such a script because they needed it for work, and PowerShell was specified as the language. The script uses the built-in Word API from Microsoft and can replace the headers and footers of Word documents, but unfortunately, it doesn't always work. I have made many attempts to improve the script over the years, but none have been crowned with success.

slides.imageAltText: sketch of the main function of the script

projectMenuItems.title: Mongo Python
projectMenuItems.text: Mongo Python is actually called Jukebox and is a final project of a module, developed by a colleague and myself. It is a small web app that can play music and store the music in a MongoDB.
projectMenuItems.moreInfoText: The goal of the project was to develop a web app that can play music, save it in playlists, and store the music in a MongoDB. The web app should also have a user interface to manage the music. The project was implemented with VueJs as the frontend and Python as the backend. The database runs in a Docker-Container.
